html:
Monday, Feb 14

February 14 (Renewables Now) - Apollo Power Ltd (TLV:APLP) has received an order from Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) in France to install a 450-kWp solar power system on top of a logistics building and a sidewalk, using the Israeli firm's flexible solar films.

The order is worth about EUR 750,000 (USD 848,000) and is expected to be executed in the final quarter of 2022. The parties are seen to also sign a service agreement in the near future.

Apollo Power noted that this project could lead to more orders from Amazon involving other logistic centres. Its technology is one of the ways through which the e-commerce giant is trying to achieve 100% power consumption from renewables by 2025.

(EUR 1.0 = USD 1.131)
